alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern New Hanover, southeastern Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leland and downtown Wilmington, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Wrightsville Beach, North Masonboro Island, Figure Eight Island, Bishop, Hightsville, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Masonboro, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Mayfaire, Wrightsboro, Batarora, Town Creek, Silver Lake, Windemere and Bayshore. This includes the following highways... Interstate 140 US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 38 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
